data.title: College parents need to find this restaurant
data.text: Because it's off the main Bethlehem strip it is not getting the crowds it should be getting. What a nice upscale steak and seafood dinner we all enjoyed. I had the bacon wrapped scallops with a baked potato and Cesar salad. I added a cup of soup. The New England clam chowder was full of clams. My husband had the almond crusted Mahi Mahi with a white chocolate sauce, I tried his and it was amazing. I will go back and order that. He added the tuna bites which were cooked perfectly. The couple we went with had the combo crab cake and lobster  tail and the other got the ribeye and lobster tail. When everything came it was all cooked perfectly and presentation was superb. The rolls kept coming and the salads were a nice blend , with 2 homemade dressings. The restaurant has its own parking lot and it is quiet enough to talk with your guests. And the menu print was large enough for 50 year olds not to get there iPhone flash lights out!

data.title: Not Sure We'll Return
data.text:
Our Waitress, Aislynn, was great.

Our Appetizers -- the Cold Crab Dip and the Blackened Tuna Bites both exceeded expectations and were excellent!

The big DISAPPOINTMENT was the King Crab Legs. There is really no info on the menu about how these are prepared, except that they are split (which is the only good thing about then). Every restaurant that I have ordered crab legs in (and there have been many), they are served steamed (or maybe simply boiled). These were either broiled or grilled, which might have been okay if they were done plain, but they were greasy, buttery (which made them too rich for my taste). They were also very salty and fishy. I felt so disappointed. For a $29 entree, this didn't deliver. I'll stick with crab legs from Marblehead or lump crab cocktail from Youells or Kingfish. They are much more to my liking. There was a special side of red roasted potatoes, those were fine.

My husband had a Ribeye and Crabcake combo. I guess they were okay, but he said we wouldn't be rushing to return to this restaurant. Maybe that's because they forgot his second side of asparagus totally (menu says the combo meals are served with two sides). Kids were happy with their meals.

The Ladies' room... Ugh. I sent my preschooler into one of the stalls, the middle one was set up for Handicap, so I used the one on the other end. It had an all-the-way through crack in the toilet seat. It seams like that is something that could be EASILY replaced. It struck me as laziness that it was left like that.

Leaving the restaurant, I followed a pathway to the right (looked to be the quickest way to the back parking lot), and I stepped on a loose/unfinshed (?) slate step that shifted underfoot. That should have been roped off or a cone alerting customers NOT to walk that way. Someone could get injured!

data.title: Seeking good Seafood
data.text: We have been looking for a good seafood restaurant and after reading a review in the local magazine decided to go give it a try.  We came around 7pm there were only a few people there so i don't think one needs to make a reservation. We ordered the calamari to start which was good. Came with 3 sauces marinara, a pesto which we didn't like , it just doesn't go together and a delicious Thai chili sauce. The thai chili sauce they use to make a shrimp entree as we found out later that we will come back to try as the sauce is really good.  my husband ordered the mahi mahi which was encrusted with almonds and a white chocolate beurre sauce..  although the fish was very good and flaky the sauce was way too sweet and over powered the fish.  I had the Caribbean jerk tuna.  The seasoning was good not too heavy with just the right kick.  Overall the quality of the food was good.  The place is rather large and can accommodate big groups, i don't know why there were so few people.  For now it is still byob, but from what the owner told us their liquor license came through so the bar will be opening soon.  Perhaps they will get more business, hopefully.

data.title: Ok lunch
data.text: We visited on a Friday afternoon for lunch. Not many people in the restaurant. My wife had the crab cake and the sweet potato fries. She enjoyed both. I had the "lobster" roll. The role that it was on was very enjoyable. However, the seafood salad in the roll was certainly not Lobster. It was a combination of imitation crab legs and imitation crab meat. It tasted ok, however if you're calling it a lobster roll I would assume that there would have been Lobster meat in the salad.

data.title: We love this place!
data.text: My boyfriend and I have been here several times and we love it. The food is delicious  (my favorite is the bacon wrapped scallops and their ranch dressing is to die for) and the service is great! We love Reggie! This restaurant is a BYO so we often bring our own wine.

data.title: Great food - wonderful service.
data.text:
Have been meaning to go to Adagio since it opened and I finally went and I am so glad I did. Could not complain about anything.  If you like crab, the legs are large and split (the only way to eat them). Calamari was good and came with 3 dipping sauces. I chose the Chicken Oscar - done perfectly with lots of crabmeat.  No dessert too full.
I wish I remembered the waitress name -m she was happy and professional.

data.title: First time here
data.text: We had a very nice meal at Adagio. It was our first time here and it was very enjoyable. Our waitress was very nice and the food was very good.

data.title: Excellent service and food!
data.text:
This was our first time trying this restaurant and we were very happy. We had fish tacos as our appetizer which were very tasty.  I ordered the crab cakes and they were too spicy for me so my husband ate them. Our server graciously offered to replace them a few times for me but my husband was happy with them. We also had the pecan encrusted Mahi Mahi which was excellent as were the sweet potato fries.
This place has a nice cozy atmosphere but what impressed us the most was the service. Our server Katie was so sweet and pleasant and did an excellent job.
All the workers were friendly and made us feel welcome.
This restaurant is definitely worth going to and we will be returning for sure.

data.title: Very Good PLace to eat
data.text:
We went there for lunch and the food was delicious.  I had a lobster roll which was very nice and tasty.  My daughter had the pesto burger and it was done just the way she ordered it.  She said it was very juicy.  Love the waffle fries.  
The only negative that I found was our waiter.  When he first came to our table he was cleaning his ears with his fingers.  At the end of our lunch when he came to take our plates away, he was cleaning his gums with his fingers.  A big turn off.  He did not offer any coffee or dessert- not sure if they even have dessert. 
If we would have had a different server I would have given this review 5 stars.

data.title: Great restaurant. Have to try.
data.text: Great food. Great early dining specials. Friendly & attentive staff. Highly recommend. Won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: I would of given this rating a 5 had it not been for the service. The service left a lot to be desired. Refills on beverages were never offered. We waited on our check for 15 minutes. You could hear the waiter joking around in the kitchen so I went back to get him. With that being said our meal was very good. The food was prepared fresh and made to order. We will return. Hopefully the service will improve.

data.title: Stalking the elusive lobster roll
data.text: My wife loves lobster rolls, which wouldn't be a problem if we lived in New England, or down the shore (yeah, I'm a Jersey guy). But there aren't many lobster rolls on the menus in the Lehigh Valley. So when a friend told her that Adagio had a tasty one at a low price, we headed there. It was a good move. The place has a nice interior, and a friendly hostess. (We were there for late lunch.) My wife is also a fan of clam chowder. So her order was obvious. I got wings (for the same reason Edmund Hillary said he climbed Everest -- because they were there) and the blackened cod sandwich (because any time I can eat burned food without being labeled a barbarian, I'm all in). The wings were great. They had the same sort of crispy outside found in good Korean chicken wings, and a nice mix of heat and sweet. The sandwich was good, on the spicy side. The waffle fries were tasty. My wife enjoyed both the chowder and the lobster roll. She got the vegetable medley as her side, and enjoyed it a lot. Thanks to half-price apps on Tuesday and a $5-off $20-or-more coupon, along with low prices to start with, we probably had the least expensive seafood meal of the year.

data.title: Amazing food and service!
data.text: Our visit was great from the minute we walked in the door until we left. Our waitress, Olivia, was super friendly and attentive. The food portions were huge and the flavors were unique. We were really happy with our meal. The manager came over to check in with us - a nice touch. We ordered the Ciroc Shrimp for the app and the sauce was out of this world. We had salad and the citrus mint dressing was really refreshing. For entrees - crab cakes with a chipotle sauce -- so much crab meat and a nice flavor to them -- with sweet potato fries -- a MUST try! Also had the pesto salmon and a baked potato with old bay butter. The whole meal was so satisfying! $52 for the meal. We had the Living Social coupon but will definitely return with or without a coupon.

data.title: Discount Coupon
data.text: Food was very good. Atmosphere was cozy. Waitress Olivia was wonderfull. Prices are reasonable with some really cheap early bird dinners. Manager made at least 3 trips to our table to make sure everything was OK. This is also a BYOB.

data.title: A leisurely lunch with my friends
data.text:
First visit, but certainly not the last.  From the relaxing background music, the well done decoration of the dinning room to the presentation of the food.  Dorian welcomed us and Jessica did a very attentive but not overwhelming in taking care of our needs.
The food was delicious and the cheesecake set off my lunch experience

data.title: Pleasant evening second visit.
data.text:
Service excellent. Friendly server and manager. Attentive and efficient. COD with chips was a nice size portion and had a nice flavor. The ribeye was cooked to perfection  and LARGE   Baked potato was a real treat. Perfect. The salads were a nice size and we loved the citrus mint balsamic dressing and the regular dressing were a fine compliment to the greens.   We love that this is a BYO. Prices are right. 
I would recommend this place to all.

data.title: Nice Decor - OK food
data.text:
The meals were very average.  Expected more from this newly redone restaurant.
Place is attractive & service was good.

data.title: Early Dinner
data.text:
Place decor and staff were very nice...

Sorry but. ."clam chowder " was nothing more than heated milk with lots of potatoes(loosing their skin). Wife's bacon wrapped scallops in herb butter had no taste whatsoever, my salmon with pesto was actually sour. Stopped for tacos on the way home.

data.title: Awesome food and ambience!
data.text: We thought we'd try someplace new, and we are so glad we decided to try Adagio!  My entree (the bacon-wrapped scallops) was fantastic!  While the presentation was impressive, the food was absolutely delicious, and perfectly cooked by the chef, Frank.  My date said his battered cod was very high quality filets with perfect, light breading.  The service was excellent and very attentive.  I can definitely see us going back there again and again.  The fact that it's a BYOB establishment makes it even better, if that's possible.  All in all, an excellent experience!

data.title: Great
data.text: Everything is prepared perfect here!!!! Check it out!!! Located on 530 Pembroke rd...the old lantern!!!  Liquor licence coming soon!!
